rComments: He is definitely one of the better lecturers in the Stats department and puts in alot more effort than most other profs in his courses.I think his lectures were interesting, and he makes an effort to relate stats to real life problems. However his tests can be difficult/tricky but he listens to feedback and makes adjustments.
Super hard

Worst prof I've ever had. Makes a easy stat course unbelievably hard. His slides are full of bs and very hard to read, however u gotta memorize the details to pass the course. Avoid him or u suffer for the entire semester.
He is like the worst professor ever in my university life
His lecture is intense indeed, but I learned a lot about statistics from him. And his test is quite fair, how much you work for it gives you how many marks you can get. And he curves a lot!
He makes me hate statistics
His test extremely hardAnd grade average 40+
Please, Mark, if you accidentally see this. Focus on researches, stop teaching ASAP.
He ruins an interesting statistical course. cant follow his lecture and his lecture slides.

Easiest stats prof in the department, hands down. His exams are very fair and if you study past exams, you are set to go. If you think he is difficult, take Dragan's class and tell me how that goes, lol.
Boring lectures, hard exams, avoid him
Decent prof, he curves marks when average is low. Study the slides, textbook, and past midterm exams to get good mark, and he also allows cheat sheet so use that to carry you during exams.

Really bad prof, doesn't really give a lot of practice questions to prepare for his midterm and final exam. Worst of all, his past final exams are restricted so you can't even practice doing past finals.
Very difficult final exam. Very little help in his class. I am an economics student actually and take harder course. I really regret it.
Cant follow the lecture

Great Prof for 302, connects you with all the following stats course you r gonna need in the future. Really fair test, as long as you understand his slides, you are good. All the questions are from his slides so read it super carefully and understand it. Beside that, you don't have to do anything
Exam was hard. His lecture went through everything very quickly and very hard to understand. Tutorial was useless.

hes seems nice and all but the marking scheme for his exam/tests are pretty harsh and I really don't think its fair that on the exam he put 5 multiple choice questions each worth 3-4 marks each that were very tricky for an exam out of 90 especially since we had long proof worth the same amount
I lose my point in quiz because I did not add a parentheses on integrand.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Lots of homework', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: He test on everything on his slides, and you don't need to read things other than those he gave you. Very inspirational lectures. Though Tests are heavy, but if you work hard, it's not very hard to get good marks. BTW, he's so handsome Going to take another of his lecture next semester ;D
Great and caring professor. Slides are really useful but lectures can be a bit boring because of his monotonic tone. Piazza is well maintained and responses are quick.
He's an amazing person but his way of teaching feels like I should already know the content before the lecture
The tests and quizzes are hard!!!!
Terrible choice of textbook

slides nonsense. tests and quiz are extremely hard. even though you go to lectures and study hard, still can't understand the tests. only curve up a little. can't bring cheatsheet and his formula sheet doesn't help at all.
nice guy
Talking nonsense in class, talking nonsense on Piazza.
Mark is a great prof who gives fair grades for students who study. Unfortunately, most people in my STA305 section didn't show up or pay attention, which leads to him curving the class quite a bit.

He teaches everything that could shows up on test and exam and he explains concepts as clearly as he can. GO TO HIS LECTURES!!! He curves, like a lot. I ended up with a 4.0 which should be a 3.0 before the curve.
Thanks a lot to prof. He tried his best to let students pass.

He is a good instructor for this course. He tried to let students being engaged during the lectures, and explained most concepts clearly. This course is not easy, but if you try hard enough and do all the practice questions he assigned, you will do well on this important course.
Lectures were dry, and I hated how he decided to make his course 40% midterm, 60% final. His slides could stand to be more detailed as well.
Best prof ever, gonna take STA305 with him

I don't know what these other comments are talking about. Mark is actually a very good teacher. He shares plenty of good metaphors of concepts to help remember the important concepts which I think is what makes him much more unique than other profs.
Well he is a pretty nice guy in the office hour, but 302 is pretty dry, and his monotone makes it even drier.

He is a nice person and always reply your email within a day. Course is hard, test asks you many details. As a prof he is caring, big curves and adjusts marks all the time. Whole course is 1 midterm and 1 exam, so a lot of people get lazy and fall behind. Listen to his lecture carefully, you will be ok
He is a really nice guy. But it's really hard to follow him during class. And he focus on very detail stuff on midterms.

Don't take any courses with him. He gives two sections of the class totally different exams and the night session is far away hard than the day session. He ends up curving up night session the same as the day session. But it's not fair at all. Because a person might get a absolutely different grade when you doing the easier version test (day sess).

Don't see clear logic in those lengthy slides. Jumps back and forth between slides. Well, it is much easier to follow if u put the actual equation in slides rather than "from week X page y" Spam pt from 2003, and test is nowhere near any of those. "Need more info", "None of the above" are generally not correct answers to MC, except in STA302.
His test answer is too subjective especially for the graph part and multiple choice. To those who want to take sta305 or sta302 with him, drop it NOW!

I have to mention that he is good at making fancy ppt. But... his midterm will ruin your life... he doesn't know how to test student properly... anyway, he is bad bad! Do take this courses with him expect that you are a genius.

I don't think he knows how to teach. Aside from speaking slowly, he does not have fluid conversational skills. Used "ummm", "uhh" a total of 40 times in 10 minutes. I know this because once you hear it, you cant unhear it.

In conjunction with the other person teaching this course, he is the worst professor I have ever had. Has no idea what is going on most of the time and he speaks at a rate of 1 word a minute and still manages to be unclear in getting his point across. Do not under any circumstance take a course that he is teaching

only been in Prof Ebdens calculus class for two weeks but could tell you after the first day that this man is truly inspiring. You can tell he deeply cares for his students (putting in requests for textbooks in the library/ taking his students questions all the way to the textbook author for answers) feel extremely lucky to be his student
Prof. Ebden was great and helpful. He encourages lecture participation via texting so the class can participate anonymously.  Great prof!
